channel.title: How do I use a mod?
channel.description:
I used to play minecraft a lot, but I never tried any mods. I want to use this one http://www.minecraftforum.net/topic/227822-15-01-millenaire-npc-village-055-village-map-better-free-space-finder/
How do I use it? Like where do I download it and etc?

item.title: How do I use a mod?
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“marcbob, post:17, topic:395813”][quote author=krackkid link=topic=493001.msg3604445#msg3604445 date=1305950953]
Do you remember to delete the META-INF folder?
[/quote]

Yeah I delete everytime before I try to load up minecraft.[/quote]
Everytime? Are you using the paid version, and if not, do you have force update on?

Read full topic
item.source: How do I use a mod?

item.title: How do I use a mod?
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

[quote=“LilXCj, post:14, topic:395813”][quote author=marcbob link=topic=493001.msg3604433#msg3604433 date=1305949592]

Ah, I remember now. I forgot that Millenaire was different with its installation process.

Install Modloader and delete META-INF.
Drag the Millenaire folder from the “put in minecraft folder” into the .minecraft directory.
Drag the millenaire.zip from the “put in mods folder” into the .minecraft/mods directory

How exactly do I install modloader?
[/quote]you copy the modloader classes into the minecrat jar

K I did that so I’m still not sure why it’s not working

Are you opening minecraft.jar with winRAR?[/quote]

21k9h00.png1340×562

Kinda shows what I did

Read full topic

item.title: How do I use a mod?
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

[quote=“LilXCj, post:8, topic:395813”]For Millenium to work you need these:

1.) Modloader by Risugami
2.) Millenium

Install Modloader FIRST to your minecraft.jar. Delete META-INF.
Run Minecraft then close it once Modloader loads once. (New files appear in your .minecraft folder)
Install Millenium in your minecraft.jar and add the millenium.zip to the new mods folder of your .minecraft directory.

Load a new world.

Millenium has a README.file, replace the extension to .txt to read the instructions. That’s how it was the last time I used it.[/quote]

It’s different now but I did everything the readme says but I think what I am doing wrong is something with the modloader. I opened it with winrar and added all the files in there to minecraft.jar. Not sure if that is right.

Read full topic
item.source: How do I use a mod?

item.title: How do I use a mod?
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

For Millenium to work you need these:

1.) Modloader by Risugami
2.) Millenium

Install Modloader FIRST to your minecraft.jar. Delete META-INF.
Run Minecraft then close it once Modloader loads once. (New files appear in your .minecraft folder)
Install Millenium in your minecraft.jar and add the millenium.zip to the new mods folder of your .minecraft directory.

Load a new world.

Millenium has a README.file, replace the extension to .txt to read the instructions. That’s how it was the last time I used it.

Read full topic
item.source: How do I use a mod?

Did this. Still won’t work.
